result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Michael Wertschnig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung  DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson DF:  Steven Michael Wertschnig appeared. Case called at 8:42. Court reviews file. ADA Hartung updates the court. Atty. Harrelson responds.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to 15CM584. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 15CM584. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: 
90 days St. Croix County Jail I/S
1 year probation concurrent to current probation
Court notes 2 days credit against any ultimate sentence.
If incarcerated huber granted. 
- DE to participate in MRT.
- Costs 
  Apply bond on file. Remainder to be paid through probation. 
- Restitution of $6.81
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- Maintain employment.
Plea hearing at 11-18-2015 08:30 am

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson DF: Steven Michael Wertschnig appeared. Case called at 11:17. Atty. J. Harrelson. gme
Karen Wertschnig 15R 014543. eif
Pre-trial conference at 10-08-2015 11:15 am

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kwik Trip Baldwin WI.   The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Matthew L Hartung,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Steven Michael Wertschnig appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Defendant is on a PO hold.ADA Hartung requests $500.00 CB.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 11:15 am.
